title: Business Live: Toys 'R' Us plans closures - BBC News
summary: rbs to close 260 branches and axe 680 staff .

documents.title: reality check : will tax plan hurt trump ?
text: reality check : will tax plan hurt trump ?
author: Tara McKelvey
BBC White House Correspondent

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's all from business live for this week .
do join us again on monday at 0600 gmt for all the latest business news .

documents.title: us markets close
text: all the main indexes saw a sharp dip late morning on the news of michael flynn 's guilty plea .
they recovered some of the lost ground but remained lower overall than thursday 's close .
dow jones share index ended the day 41.58 points or 0.17 % lower at 24,230.77
s & p 500 closed 5.39 points or 0.2 % lower at 2,642.19 .
and the nasdaq finished 27.19 points or 0.4 % lower at 6,846.78 .

documents.title: toys 'r ' us 'will never win that fight '
text: toy retailers , fashion retailers , everyone is going to reduce the size of their stores , '' says retail analyst kate hardcastle .
`` in the coming 24 months you will see a lot more of this sort of news . ''
toys r us has aisles and aisles stacked high with products , but they will never win that fight with the internet '' .

documents.title: toys 'r ' us : what is the plan ?
text: more details on the story that toys 'r ' us is preparing a restructuring plan in the uk .
the retailer has 106 stores in britain and is planning to close around a quarter of them if the plan is approved by its creditors .
it would all be part of a deal to renegotiate debts owed by the company to its landlords - a lot of those big-box out-of-town stores are proving expensive to keep up .
but the toy giant needs to win approval from 75 % of creditors in order to get the company voluntary arrangement that would allow it to continue trading without being pursued for the money it owes .

documents.title: oil stocks buoyant
text: shortly before the us markets are set to close and stocks have regained much of the ground they lost this morning when news came through that president trump 's former national security advisor , michael flynn , was pleading guilty to making false statements about meetings with the russian ambassador .
but it 's oil stocks that quietly have had the best of it today with the sector rising 0.6 % .
opec and non-opec members agreed on thursday to continue reining in output until the end of next year .
that should reduce a global glut in oil and boost prices .

documents.title: democrat disapproval
text: democrats are not impressed with the tax bill , either in its original or newly tweaked form .
`` in the waning hours , this bill is tilting further towards businesses and away from families , '' senate democratic leader chuck schumer said in a statement .
`` every time the choice is between corporations and families , the republicans choose corporations .
`` today may be the first day of a new republican party - one that raises taxes on the middle class . ''

documents.title: tax debate update
text: senate republicans say they have the 50 votes needed to pass their tax overhaul .

the bill is still a work in progress , despite a plan to vote on it later today , and there 's no formal text of the plan - which has caused some hand-wringing over how much it would increase government borrowing and whether the tax cuts are focused in the right areas .
if it gets approved it will have to somehow be merged with the tax bill that the house of representatives produced .
but in the meantime tweaks are still being made to ensure its passage .

documents.title: on a different note
text: justin bieber 's 'sorry ' becomes the fifth song ever to rack up one billion plays on spotify
for those who are too lazy to click on the link here is a screenshot of the story
@ twitterid da halsey tbem

that 's a lot of 7-12 year olds listeners .
forbes forget his fans grew up and aged as he did

soooo adorable

just have to come to terms with it there 's no stopping the biebs
coming for that diamond yas

oiche mon idole justin bieber super je ta dore et touts t est chanson son super bien you yes yo ton idol france
ony legends
sorrow is the importance of happiness
now thats nothing to be sorry about
i would like to take personal responsibility for this

documents.title: points-based system for late tax-payers
text: plans are afoot to introduce a points-based system - a bit like the way we penalise bad drivers - for those who fail to submit their tax returns on time .
at present , self-assessment submissions up to three months late incur a fine of at least £ 100 .
hmrc says new legislation would mean you 're fined if you 've up too many points .
you can read more here .

documents.title: oxford university raises £ 750m in bond issue
text: oxford university has raised £ 750m from its first bond issue - more than it anticipated and the largest amount raised this way by a uk university .
it 's the most significant example so far of universities turning to the capital markets for investment rather than student fees .
the bond is even bigger than oxford 's research funding which last year brought in £ 730m .
the university says it will use the money for improving facilities .
read more from our education correspondent , sean coughlan , here .
author: Sean Coughlan
BBC News, education correspondent

documents.title: woodford calls market 'bubble '
text: high-profile fund manager , neil woodford , has told the financial times he believes markets around the wrold are in a `` bubble '' and that when it bursts it could prove `` even bigger and more dangerous '' than many previous market crashes .
he 's warning of `` extreme and unsustainable valuations '' .

evidence includes bitcoin going through $ 10,000 , european junk bonds yielding less than us treasuries , exchange traded funds attracting huge investment and other things he terms `` lights flashing red '' .
woodford got out of tech stocks before the dotcom crash and shunned bank stocks before 2007 .
so you could argue it 's worth hearing him out on this .

documents.title: toys 'r ' struggling
text: just a reminder - back in september toys 'r ' us filed for bankruptcy in the us and canada .
you can read our news story about that here .

at the time they said the firm 's operations outside north america were not part of the proceedings , but all parts of the firm have been up against the same kind of challenges : online competition , supermarkets and other retailers increasingly stocking toys , and perhaps above all children moving on to electronic entertainment .

documents.title: is toys 'r ' us headed for a restructuring ?
text: sky news is reporting that the retail chain toys 'r ' us is about to unveil plans to close a quarter of its uk stores after the christmas trading period .
the broadcaster says the firm could announce as early as monday that it 's launching a company voluntary arrangement , giving it protection from creditors as works out a new financial strategy .
that 's likely to affect several hundred jobs , if it does come to pass .
toys 'r ' us has 105 uk outlets - ty big warehouse-style out-of-town stores , which are costly , and vulnerable to online rivals .

documents.title: us shares remain lower
text: a quick lunch-time ( in new york in any case ) check on the us share markets shows they 've made up some of the ground lost mid-morning .
but they 're still lower than the opening .
dow jones index is down 0.34 % - or 83 points lower - at 24,188 .
s & p is down by 0.51 % - or 13 points - at 2,634 .
and the nasdaq is 0.89 % off - or 61 points lower - at 6,812 .

documents.title: shkreli should forfeit $ 7.4m , say prosecutors
text: martin shkreli , who infamously ratcheted up the price of a life-saving drug by 5,000 % , should forfeit $ 7.4m , according to prosecutors in the us .
it was his `` pharma bro '' activities that catapulted him into the limelight , but he was actually convicted in august of defrauding investors in hedge funds that he ran years before that .
assets he could lose include a picasso painting , a stake in turing pharmaceuticals , and an enigma machine , which was used in world war ii as a code breaker .
he may have to handover his wu tang album , which will delight music fans .
when shkreli said he was buying the only existing copy of the album `` once upon a time in shaolin '' he declared he had no plans to listen to it .

documents.title: wto boss warns trade talks 'wo n't be easy '
text: wto boss warns trade talks 'wo n't be easy '

documents.title: is bitcoin coming of age ?
text: it 's been quite a week for the digital currency which hit a record of $ 11,400 on wednesday .
now two exchanges will be allowed to trade in bitcoin-related contracts .
us regulator approves bitcoin trading
booooom ! !
approved !

crypto currency needs to come under the body of general regulation , if it is to become the singular currency it needs to fit in today 's general society to both grow and adopt to every potential user .
so embrace regulation it 's a huge step forward .
@ twitterid
@ twitterid your moneybox live next week will discuss the reality of bitcoin , not just trot out old cliches about bubbles , money-laundering & illegal activities !
sadly ratty will be in amsterdam on weds ( bitcoin & musical creative tour ) otherwise would have contributed !
wow , permission to trade !
we 're so fortunate .
/s { let this sink in } .
good , now it 's taxable
who gives a shit lol it 's going to traded anyways with or without regulation
has @ twitterid got a few ?

documents.title: the trump-russia saga in 200 words
text: if you could do with a reminder of what 's behind all this , here 's a handy one-pager .

documents.title: us markets shaken by flynn reports
text: american markets are reacting to reports - on abc news - that trump 's former national security advisor michael flynn is prepared to testify that president trump directed him to make contact with russians when he was the presidential candidate .
there 's no way to corroborate those reports at this stage , but investors are wary .
the s & p 500 index fell 1.3 % ; dow jones industrial average was off 1.15 % ; nasdaq was down 1.77 % .
bond prices are up and yields down too .

documents.title: london market close : shares
text: london 's share market index ended the day 0.36 % lower , a fall of 26.18 points to 7,300.49 .

documents.title: london market close : sterling
text: the pound , which we 've been keeping an eye on , was little changed against the dollar at the end of the trading day - $ 1.3508 at 4.30pm friday compared to $ 1.3504 thursday .
against the euro sterling was a bit lower .
at the end of friday a pound is worth €1.1332 compared , down 0.3 % from thursday .

documents.title: the meghan effect
text: those of you who doubted there was a business angle to the prospective royal nuptials , time for a rethink .

after meghan and harry 's walkabout in nottingham today , edinburgh-based handbag firm strathberry has completely sold out of its £ 455 `` tri-colour leather midi tote '' which adorned the arm of the bride-to-be .
the company is naturally `` thrilled and honoured '' and will be restocking soon .
now , how are sales of the cashmere wool-blend coat going ?

documents.title: costing a packet
text: well , this takes the biscuit
supermarkets 'raise the price of christmas biscuits '
how very dare they ?

documents.title: why are branches being axed ?
text: brokers hargreaves lansdown says there are three main factors behind the bank branch closures :

documents.title: small businesses lament bank closures
text: responding to the latest round of rbs branch closures , mike cherry , chairman of the federation of small businesses says his members are concerned .
smaller firms still want the `` in-person support they receive at branches '' he says .
and while most do use online banking , that can be a challenge in areas `` still blighted by poor broadband '' , says mr cherry .
plus shoppers need to be able to get their hands on cash , he says , especially if the cash machine network is about to be cut back .
cash is still critical to trade in thousands of our towns and villages , especially in tourist hotspots and rural areas .
`` more and more small firms are accepting card payments but that comes with costs they 're forced to absorb .
equally , many have customers that only deal in cash . ''

documents.title: us tax vote looms despite deficit alert
text: this may be what is weighing on investors minds .
the republican-controlled senate plans a vote on friday despite a $ 1tn deficit warning on the bill .

documents.title: us markets open
text: us share markets have opened lower with the dow jones average sliding 40 points - or 0.15 % in the first 15 minutes of trading .
the broader s & p is 4 points - also 0.15 % - lower .
and the nasdaq is 17 pints or 0.25 % down .

documents.title: fortnum 's record sales
text: fortnum and mason has reason to raise a toast again this christmas season : sales for the year to july rose 14 % to a record £ 113m .
that 's the fifth year of double-digit rises , while profits also hit a record £ 7.6m .
however , fortnum and mason 's boss is worried about how the drop in sterling is making it harder to recruit staff from the continent .
but at least the throngs of foreign visitors , keen to bag a weak-pound bargain , is a source of comfort .
read more here .

documents.title: us tax bill : 'the big enchilada ' ?
text: `` this is the big enchilada , '' said senator johnny isakson of georgia on thursday .
he was referring to the controversial republican tax bill currently under debate .
let 's hope senators have got an appetite for more .
discussions went on until late last night , with a surprise endorsement from senator john mccain boosting expectations that the bill could be put to a vote later today .
that helped the s & p and dow jones close higher on thursday .
but with us markets about to open shortly , signs are that shares will move lower again .
there 's still little consensus on what the impact of these tax plans will be on the economy and the deficit .
and there are proposals for all sorts of amendments from both republicans and democrats .
still plenty of scope to make a meal of it before it 's passed .

documents.title: rbs closures are 'matter of great concern '
text: the scottish government business minister has said the closure of 259 rbs branches is `` a matter of great concern '' .

paul wheelhouse told the world at one that the closure , which involves the loss of 62 branches in scotland , would `` impact on customers '' , particularly those `` who are n't able to go online or use digital services '' .
he added that he would be speaking to senior management at rbs `` to discuss what possible mitigation can be taken '' .
author: The World at One
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: new easyjet boss starts
text: easyjet 's new boss said he wants the airline to go from `` strength to strength '' as he started his role on friday .
chief executive johan lundgren , who has replaced carolyn mccall , met pilots , cabin crew and passengers at the carrier 's luton airport headquarters .

`` having flown with easyjet as a customer many times and competed against the airline for many years , i am full of admiration for the fantastic airline that carolyn mccall and the whole easyjet team have built , '' he said .
`` my ambition is to help easyjet go from strength to strength . ''
the former tui executive will be paid an annual salary of £ 740,000 , and be eligible to earn a maximum annual bonus of 200 % of his salary .
dame carolyn joins itv as the broadcaster 's first female chief executive in january .

documents.title: breakingbitcoin gets the nod
text: bitcoin rebounded on friday to around the $ 10,500 level , after earlier falling below $ 9,500 after the us derivatives regulator said it would allow cme group and cboe global markets to list bitcoin futures .

the announcement by the commodity futures trading commission ( cftc ) paves the way for cme and cboe to become the first traditional us regulated exchanges to launch trading in bitcoin-related financial contracts - a watershed moment for the cryptocurrency that could lead to greater regulatory scrutiny .

it has been a volatile week for bitcoin , which broke through $ 10,000 before rocketing past $ 11,000 less than 12 hours later to a record high of almist $ 11,400 , before plunging by a fifth in the hours that followed .

documents.title: oxford 's 100-year bond
text: things move a little more slowly in the rareified atmosphere of oxford 's cloisters and spires .
the university is tapping the markets with a bond that matures in not one , not 10 or even 25 years , but a full century away .
it is the first time the institution as a whole , rather than individual colleges , have raised funds in this way .
the bond issue , which will raise at least £ 250m , goes on sale today .
it is being run by jp morgan and is likely to appeal to pension funds and institutions wanting stable returns over a long period .
we find out later how much oxford will pay to borrow the funds , but given that credit rating agency moody 's has given the university its highest aaa rating , chances are it wo n't be too onerous .

documents.title: not logging on
text: itv news consumer editor chris choi tweets :
over 70 % of uk bank customers manage money online .
but 87 % of the over 80s never use the internet for financial transactions - so we have to take care that this gigantic shift to digital transactions does n't leave people excluded
really ?
queuing out of the door @ twitterid bramhall just now
hi ian , sorry for the delay in branch today .
please let me know if there 's anything i can help with .
md
long queues very common in several branches we use to pay in business cheques .
atm pay in no use as does n't work with our accounts system
i see , we do offer the option to pay in at post offices > ej
they are all closing too !
hi lynn , 99.7 % of all our uk customers will live within 15 minutes of a branch , a mobile branch stop or post office .
our fleet of mobile branches serve over 603 uk communities each week through 717 stops in towns and villages .
dw
always have to queue at my busy branch , so why is it closing ?
hi lynn , i can assure you that taking the decision to close the branches is not taken lightly .
we provide a range of alternative ways to bank , tailored to the needs of our customers .
customers are increasingly using alternative ways to
it gets me how banks have the gall to repeatedly show tear jerking adverts on tv about how dedicated they are to damaged communities , whilst closing much needed branches for more profit
absolutely agree we are in real danger of excluding a generation .
will someone please tell me how i pay in a cheque or that stuff called cash online ?
shame older people were n't thinking of us younger ones when quite a few of them voted for brexit .
maybe we can just tell them online banking is the will of the people .
@ chrisitv and those who can not afford to own a computer should not be doing their banking on library machines - insecure .
it already has
lots of old folk do n't even like atm 's i feel for them they prefer the human touch but it 's the way of the world now we have to move with the times
and are these older people also in all the villages closing down banks ?
i 'd suggest yes

documents.title: cyber-thieves cash in on bitcoin boom
text: bitcoin 's booming value has driven a huge rise in crypto-currency themed malware , say security firms .
in one month , anti-malware software company malwarebytes said it stopped almost 250 million attempts to place coin-mining malware on to pcs .
symantec said it had seen a `` tenfold '' increase in the amount of malicious code connected with crypto-cash .
read more here .

documents.title: gm venture launches china recall
text: a chinese vehicle maker , joint owned by america 's general motors , is recalling nearly one million vehicles following problems with their fuel tank problems .
saic-gm-wuling 's recall of 938,686 vehicles covers two models of the venture 's popular baojun cars which sold more than two million vehicles last year .
it 's the latest in a string of recalls in the world 's largest car market this year .
china 's quality watchdog said in september that gm and its china ventures would recall over 2.5 million vehicles over airbag issues .

documents.title: a different language
text: is there a difference in the way that men and women converse ?
will this make you take a second look at the way you talk at work ?

documents.title: brazil recovering
text: brazil 's economy is still on path to a modest recovery , official numbers reveal .
the country 's gdp expanded by 0.1 % in the third quarter of 2017 .
since january , brazil 's economy has grown by 0.6 % .
brazil has been recovering from its worst recession in history due in part to pro-business reforms carried on by the government of president michel temer .
however , analysts now believe mr temer does not have enough votes to approve a crucial pension reform this year , which could threat the country 's plan to fix its finances .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: oil prices extend gains
text: oil prices extended gains on friday after opec and non-opec nations led by russia to extend production cuts to the end of 2018 .
brent is up 0.8 % at $ 63.10 per a barrel .
west texas intermediate is up 0.6 % at $ 57.76 .
bjarne schieldrop , chief commodities analyst at nordic bank seb , says : `` opec and the cooperating producers will maintain production cuts at 1.8 million barrels a day the end of 2018 .
progress will be reviewed in june . ''

documents.title: rbs branch closures : in your town ?
text: as rbs says it 'll close a quarter of its branches , seems a good time to repost this on what may come next
and here 's where those branches will close .
more , and a link to the full list here

documents.title: thomas cook plan part of review
text: thomas cook says the 50 store closures , if they go ahead , would be a mix of thomas cook and co-operative travel branded sites .
it says the shops affected are either in close proximity to other stores or are located where a decline in footfall has impacted profitability .

thomas cook uk 's director of retail and customer experience kathryn darbandi , says : `` we continually review our network of stores across the uk to make sure we 're offering customers the best of thomas cook , and it is clear that to succeed we have to operate as a truly omni-channel business .
`` we 're one thomas cook to our customers and we will offer them a world-class service whichever channel they chose to book , be that retail or online . ''

documents.title: breakingthomas cook explores shop closures
text: thomas cook says it may close down 50 of its shops between now and march next year .

documents.title: trump tax plan doubts
text: still on trump for a moment , business presenter susannah streeter tweets :
will trump 's tax plan help wealth trickle down the economy ?
former presidential adviser to geroge w bush , dr pippa malgrem tells us @ twitterid that many firms have plans for share buy backs not investment in people
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: morrisons liable for staff details breach
text: morrisons has been found liable for the actions of a former member of its staff who stole the data of thousands of employees and posted it online .
workers brought a claim against the company after employee andrew skelton stole the data , including salary and bank details , of nearly 100,000 staff .
the high court ruling now allows those affected to claim compensation for the `` upset and distress '' caused .
the case is the first data leak class action in the uk .
read more here .

documents.title: sterling trades lower
text: sterling has reversed this morning 's gains and is now down 0.28 % against the dollar at $ 1.34890 .
the pound is also off 0.24 % on the euro at €1.13390 .

documents.title: record year for foreign investment
text: net flows of foreign direct investment ( fdi ) into the uk hit a record high in 2016 - the year of the brexit vote - boosted by major takeover deals , official figures show .
net fdi flows jumped to £ 145.6bn , the largest value recorded for a year since comparable data began to be compiled in 2006 , and up from £ 25.3bn in 2015 .
`` the large value of inward fdi flows recorded were dominated by a handful of high-value m & a deals in 2016 , '' the office for national statistics said .
`` large publically reported transactions in 2016 included the acquisitions of sabmiller , arm holdings and bg group . ''

documents.title: sharp stirs
text: shares in sharp surged nearly 8 % after the japanese electronics firm said it will return to the main section of the tokyo stock exchange this month .
falling sales of smartphone panels and restructuring costs led to financial problems and a demotion to the second section last year .
sharp 's rise added to the positive mood in japan , with the nikkei 225 up 0.4 % to close at 22,819 points .
sydney rose 0.3 % , but the hang seng index shed 0.4 % and the kospi in seoul was flat .

documents.title: joined at the hip
text: samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics comments on today 's manufacturing figures :
the rise in the manufacturing pmi will no doubt be cited by leavers as proof the prospect of brexit is n't harming the econ .
but the truth is manufacturers are only doing well because they are still closely aligned with the booming eurozone :
but we were told a leave vote would create uncertainty and the economy would collapse .
meaning leave camp claims are not credible
i read that you think britain wo n't leave the eu because at the end of transition it wo n't seem desirable .
what you missed is that britain will have already left the eu by that point , in theory transition will be done outside the eu but inside the single market & cu .
that is to say that we will be out and would require a referendum to return back in ( unlikely ) .
i thought business was fearful of an uncertain future ?
seems like you want your cake and eat it in this debacle .
it is , or it is n't and if it is manufacturing pmi would n't be doing so well .
and samuel you were predicting an immediate recession after the referendum.my back of a fag packet predictions were more accurate than yours .
you are letting emotion influence your forecasts .
yep nothing to do with the lower pound due to the brexit vote eh ? ? ?
my god `` experts ''

documents.title: twitter is paralysed by trump 's tweeting
text: once again , twitter finds itself between a rock and a far-right place .
donald trump 's retweeting of britain first 's jayda fransen on wednesday was a truly shocking moment .
theresa may said it was `` wrong '' .
it contributed , as one us news site put it , to trump 's `` darkest day '' as president .
yet as wednesday rolled into thursday , the leader of the free world retweeting a far-right organisation became just another frightful part of what we apparently refer to as the `` new normal '' .
now perhaps the most surprising element of this spectacle is n't that the president amplified the tweets of a woman who has been fined for hate speech - but that those tweets are still there .
read more here .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: 'coming up roses '
text: lee hopley , chief economist at eef , the manufacturers ' organisation , comments on the manufacturing pmi figures :

the survey points to everything coming up roses for manufacturing in the closing months of the year , with robust increases in production levels and solid growth in new orders from both uk customers and overseas .

with the european manufacturing pmis showing levels of expansion at multi-year highs , the benefits for uk exporters are clearly evident , whilst the rebound in manufacturing investment globally is driving activity growth across capital goods manufacturers in the uk .
the recent trends of manufacturing output growth outpacing that in the wider economy looks set to continue - for the next quarter at least . ''

documents.title: lufthansa concessions
text: lufthansa has offered concessions to allay competition concerns about its plan to buy air berlin assets , eu regulators said .
the european commission , which is concerned about lufthansa 's dominance as a result of the deal , extended its deadline for a decision on the deal by two weeks to 21 december .
it did not provide details of lufthansa 's concessions .
the airline is willing to give up slots owned by air berlin businesses niki and lg walter , a source told reuters .

documents.title: a matter of life and death
text: someone at the office for national statistics is feeling cheery today
how long are you likely to live ?
find out by using our life expectancy calculator :
nice .
but i 'd argue that there are lots of dimensions to life expectancy .
location being a key one .
just using gender is a wee bit limiting .
great tool for working out the time you expect to live after retirement at 65 .
note that while my expected life expectancy is 85 there 's a long probability tail .
so the chance of living to 94 is one in four .

documents.title: rising demand hits delivery times
text: commenting on the manufacturing pmi figures , duncan brock , director of customer relationships at the chartered institute of procurement & supply , says : `` as the impact of the weak pound diminished , businesses were turning their attention to new opportunities clients , and investment as business optimism flourished from october 's four-month low .

`` however , this increase in demand meant suppliers fared less well as delivery times continued to lengthen amidst the scrabble in demand and raw material shortages , leading to further rises in input costs for manufacturers which were then passed on to customers . ''

documents.title: bitcoin beats trump
text: has bitcoin become a thing ?

google says that in the past week , searches for `` bitcoin '' exceeded those for `` trump '' for the first time , data from google showed - even though president donald trump has been prominently in the news this week .

several large market exchanges including nasdaq , cboe holdings and cme group , the world 's largest derivatives exchange , have all said they are planning to provide futures contracts based on bitcoin .
the price of the cryptocurrency has fallen sharply in a period of wild trading since it passed the $ 11,000 mark earlier this week to be under $ 9,500 .

bitcoin investments are seen as mere speculation because demand has skyrocketed without fundamentals backing the cryptocurrency , says jin yong-jae , an economist at hi investment & securities in seoul .

that makes the price of bitcoin `` very much volatile '' , jin adds : `` there are people who invest in bitcoin for its future value , but most seem to be just jumping on the bandwagon , without being fully aware of the structure or how it will replace actual currencies in the future . ''

documents.title: steep gains in exports
text: ihs markit said that manufacturing production expanded at its fastest pace since september 2016 which companies linked to rising new orders `` reflecting solid domestic demand and steeper gains in new export business '' .
some businesses `` noted higher sales to clients in europe , the americas , asia and the middle east '' , ihs markit said .

documents.title: manufacturing shifts up a gear
text: rob dobson , director at ihs markit , which compiles the survey , says : `` uk manufacturing shifted up a gear in november , with growth of output , new orders and employment all gathering pace .
`` on its current course , manufacturing production is rising at a quarterly rate approaching 2 % , providing a real boost to the pace of broader economic expansion . ''

documents.title: breakinguk manufacturing at four year high
text: manufacturing activity rose in november according to the ihs markit/cips purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) .
it says that activity rose to a four year high of 58.2 compared to 56.6 in october .

documents.title: opioid treatment lifts indivior
text: indivior is one of those companies most people have never heard of , but is worth about £ 3bn , around the same value as better known firms such as jd sports or metro bank .
neil wilson at etx capital says today 's share price rise follows the fda 's green light for its sublocade monthly opioid treatment which he says should replace declining suboxone sales .

`` management is targeting a potential $ 1bn in sales , which seems conservative given this would amount to just over 600,000 doses per annum , or to put it another way , about 50,000 patients annually , '' he says .
mr wilson points out that opioid misuse has been declared a national public health emergency in the us .
`` but currently less than half of the 2.5m people diagnosed with opioid addiction are being treated .
the overall market has seen strong growth the last three years and this ought to continue . ''

documents.title: invest in bitcoin 'at your own risk '
text: the governor of france 's central bank has struck a note of caution over bitcoin , stating : `` those who invest in bitcoin do it entirely at their own risk '' .
following a volatile week of trading in bitcoin , françois villeroy de galhau says : `` there must be no ambiguity : the bitcoin is not a currency , or even a cryptocurrency .
`` it 's a speculative asset , its value and its high volatility do not correspond to any economic underpinning and are not the responsibility of anyone . ''
on wednesday , sir jon cunliffe , the bank of england 's deputy governor for financial stability , said that people `` should do their homework and think carefully '' about investing in bitcoin .

documents.title: momentum builds for games workshop
text: games workshop is upbeat on trading after reporting sales of £ 109m and £ 38m in operating profit for the first six months of the year .
the war game maker said it had seen growth in all areas of the business and that momentum was continuing .
games workshop 's share price rose 6.15 % to £ 20.78 .
retail analyst nick bubb tweets :
games workshop has been the momentum play of 2017 and it has just announced that sales in the last 6 months were 54 % up and profits nearly trebled to c£ 38m wow .
big thanks to game of thrones i suspect .
good point , although that 's been around for a while now

documents.title: indivior up in downbeat trading
text: shares in indivior rose 11.38 % to 413p after announcing that the us food and drug administration has approved its once-a-month treatment for moderate to severe opioid use disorder .
however , the ftse 250 is off 60.74 points at 19,892.15 .
anglo american led the ftse 100 risers on a lacklustre day of trading in london .
the mining group 's share price rose by 1.8 % to £ 13.84 .
meanwhile , civilian defence company babcock international 's share price fell 2.8 % at 677.5p to lead the blue chip index 's fallers .
overall , the ftse 100 is trading down 1.38 points at 7,325.29 .

documents.title: wakey wakey
text: do you struggle to get to sleep ?
a new survey says 1 in 20 of us are getting less than 4 hours of sleep a night .
yes .
if i get 2 hours a night then that 's good !
often it 's less than that .
sometimes no sleep at all !
being on fentanyl plus other meds should knock me out but no !
pain-somnia from scoliosis ehlers-danlos syndrome and arthritis does n't help x
one of those is me .
@ twitterid
this used to be me , and it 's no way to live at all .
up to a solid 6 now !
magnesium is a great natural aid to restful sleep , relaxing the body by relieving muscle tension and regulating gaba receptors , which help the brain switch off in preparation for sleep
let 's hope they do n't get in their car 's to drive to work & then nod off
too much light everywhere
i 'm not buying it from this sleep expert
indeed - i have nightmares about the @ twitterid government

documents.title: breakinghang seng suffers
text: hong kong 's hang seng suffered its biggest weekly loss in almost a year as investors booked profits from this year 's robust rally .
losses in mainland china stocks also put pressure on hong kong this week as beijing continued to tackle risks in the financial system .
the hang seng ended 103 points , or 0.35 % , lower at 29,074 points and fell 2.7 % on the week - the biggest weekly drop since december 2016 .

documents.title: fonterra to pay danone $ 125m
text: new zealand 's fonterra has been ordered to pay france 's danone €105m ( £ 92m ) over a recall prompted by a botulism scare in 2013 .
danone pulled some karicare baby milk powders after fonterra - the world 's biggest dairy producer - said there was a bacteria in its products that could cause fatal botulism .
the scare was later declared a false alarm .
fonterra cut its 2017 profit forecast following the ruling on friday .

documents.title: fortnum & mason warns on recruitment
text: fortnum & mason says it is struggling to recruit staff after the brexit vote - particularly in its restaurants .

chief executive ewan venters tells the guardian that one in five of the chef posts across its six restaurants were unfilled as the slide in sterling and concerns about anti-migrant attitudes deterred applicants .
brexit is an alarming issue for me in terms of our ability to hire and retain good people , '' he says .
staff are now asking : `` 'do i feel welcome ? '
that 's more the problem today , '' mr venters adds .
fortnum & mason 's store on piccadilly in central london employs 800 people .
about 10 % of the staff are chefs in its dining venues including the restaurant 45 jermyn st .

documents.title: ftse 100 opens higher
text: the ftse 100 opened up 7.8 points at 7,334.4 .
the ftse 250 began trading lower , down 5.3 points at 19,947.5 .

documents.title: have your say : rbs branch closuresbbc news economics journalist rebecca wearn tweets
text: # rbs has told us here @ twitterid staff have been consulted for this latest round of closures .
are you affected ?
get in touch the bank says customers using in-branch services is down 40 % since 2014
if you 've bitcoin you 've your own bank .
even better , the value of the dosh in it is n't being inflated away year on year by a central bank .
bank branches are so retro .
this is a good development .
more profit for the 'investors ' , more incomprehensible phone calls 'from our overseas branch ' .
hopefully bankers will disapoear up their own arses when we 've been paid back

documents.title: lyft narrows losses
text: lyft , the uber rival that only operates in the us thus far , has narrowed its loss in the first half of the year as revenue more than tripled , accoridng to reports .
technology news site the information said lyft 's net loss fell 27 % to $ 206m , with revenue rising to about $ 483m .
revenue for the same period last year was estimated to be about $ 150m , although comparisons are difficult because of accounting changes , the site said .
uber 's net loss ballooned by almost $ 500m to $ 1.46bn in the third quarter , reuters reported earlier this week .
both companies are privately owned and do not routinely release financial information .

documents.title: rbs is 'decimating ' its branch network
text: unite , the union , said that rbs was `` decimating '' its branch network and betraying communities .
rob macgregor , unite national officer , said : `` the royal bank of scotland has decided to decimate its bank branch network .
now serious questions need to be asked about whether these closures mark the end of branch network banking .
he says : the closure of another 259 branches is savage and represents a betrayal of loyal staff and customers who have supported the bank for decades . ''
mr macgregor adds : `` a decade of slashing jobs has done nothing to boost morale , increase consumer confidence or improve the bank 's performance .
this british-taxpayer funded bank should be concentrating on investing in jobs here in the uk , rather than cutting them wholesale . ''

documents.title: trade talks with trump 'waste of time '
text: trade talks with trump 'waste of time '

documents.title: rbs customers 'will be disappointed '
text: commenting on its decision to shut down local branches , jane howard , rbs 's managing director of branch banking , tells reuters that customers are increasingly using mobiles and the internet to manage their accounts .
`` there will be some customers that will be really disappointed we are closing branches and i understand why .
but it 's important that we do respond . ''
197 natwest branches will close and 62 rbs .
bank says there 's been a 40 % drop in people using branches since 2014

documents.title: breakingrbs to axe branches and jobs
text: royal bank of scotland has announced that it will close 259 branches and cut 680 jobs in a move to encourage customers to use online and mobile services .

the latest round of closures at the edinburgh-based bank follow 180 announced in march , putting 1,000 jobs at risk , and a similar move by lloyds banking group which said on wednesday it would close 49 branches .

documents.title: oil prices rise on opec deal
text: oil prices ticked higher on friday following an agreement between opec and major producers .
brent crude rose 0.2 % to $ 62.66 a barrel white west texas intermediate edged 0.1 % higher to $ 57.34 .

documents.title: 'easiest decision '
text: yesterday opec members agreed to extend production cuts by nine months , hoping they will boost oil prices .

spencer welch of ihs markit tells today that the cuts first imposed by opec last year took a while to kick in , but have started to have the desired effect '' - cutting inventories and sending prices higher .
the decision by opec members - and non-members of the cartel led by russia - to extend the production cuts was the easiest decision '' and is unlikely to spook the market , he adds .
but anyone hoping to see petrol prices fall anytime soon may be disappointed : mr welch says the move wo n't make much difference at the pump .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: wipeout for billabong ?
text: billabong , the australian surfwear brand , has received a takeover bid from rival quiksilver valuing the company at about $ 150m ( £ 110m ) .
it could be a lifeline for the troubled firm , which has only turned a profit in one of the past five years .
billabong suffered a $ 58m ( £ 43m ) wipeout this year - triple its 2016 loss .
the company sells clothing under eight brands and sponsors surf events around the world .
read more here .

documents.title: behind door number one
text: what 's behind your advent calendar door this morning ?
a bottle of gin ?
pork crackling ?
make-up ?
or just some humble chocolate ?
# wakeuptomoney
very true bbc in moves news
chocolate .

documents.title: the uk 'is no venezuela '
text: is the uk heading for a 'venezuela-style ' economic collapse if the country continues borrowing ?
richard sharp , a member of the bank of england 's financial stability committee is claiming that the uk has borrowed an extra £ 1trillion since the 2008 financial crisis .
but james bevan , chief investment officer at ccla , says the comment is `` reckless and inappropriate '' .
he says that a lot of venezuela 's debt is in us dollars so if a currency is devalued `` the cost of repaying that debt multiplies by the extent of the devaluation '' .
because the uk 's debt is in sterling the uk `` can ultimately print money in a way that venezuela can not '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: mind the gap
text: the national care homes association 's nadra ahmed concedes that it is not fair that some elderly people are paying more to be looked after than others .
`` of course it 's not fair .
it 's not fair that anyone should be having to pay more than somebody else in a care home because they are eating the same meals because they are getting the same care for a lot less .
`` but that a lot less is coming from a government funded local authority which is not able to reach the full cost of the care . ''
she says that care homes are already closing because they can not bridge the funding gap .
this year alone , the uk has lost 5,000 care home beds .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: care homes quandary
text: a damning report by the competition and markets authority into britain 's care home industry has found that some private patients are paying 40 % more for services than those funded by local authorities .

however , nadra ahmed , chair of the national care homes association , explains : `` what 's happening is , as a local provider with say 20 beds , you make a decision that in order for your business to be viable you need £ 800 a week to care for the people who are there .
`` what then happens is a tendering process takes place for a contract with the local authority .
`` the local authority will cap that and say 'we 're only going to pay you £ 550 and if you want us to be referring people to you that 's what you 're going to get ' .

so the provider then has to make a decision to take that contract in order to make sure they get the referrals from the local authority which is by far - and the report recognises that - the biggest purchaser of these services . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .
where will bitcoin head today ?
the cryptocurrency has retreated below $ 10,000 but given how volatile it has been in recent days , who knows where it could end by the end of the week .
overnight , the world 's largest lithium ion battery - built by tesla - has begun dispensing power into an electricity grid in south australia .
read all about it here .
we 'll be bringing you all the breaking business and economics news throughout the day .
in the meantime , we 'd love to hear from you .
contact us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
